project_context.target_audience: E-commerce store owners using Thelia 3 who need a modern, responsive front-office template for their online shop

competitors.name: PrestaShop Themes
competitors.description: Open-source e-commerce platform with marketplace of themes and modules developed by independent developers worldwide

pain_points.description: Theme quality has been declining while prices increase - paid themes and modules getting low quality and higher prices
pain_points.source: PrestaShop Forums - 'Prestashop themes and modules quality is going worst' thread
pain_points.frequency: Frequently mentioned in forums and reviews
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna can offer high-quality modern template at no cost as open-source alternative

pain_points.description: Themes are tied to creators - when a developer stops operating, the theme becomes unsupported and corrupts
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna is community-driven open-source, not dependent on single developer's business continuity

pain_points.description: Lack of SEO, UX, and performance optimizations in most themes - themes look nice but missing fundamental optimizations
pain_points.source: Capterra PrestaShop Reviews, DEV Community article
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna built with modern stack (Tailwind, Alpine.js) optimized for performance and SEO from the start

pain_points.description: Module compatibility issues - no universal standard for quality, modules don't work seamlessly together
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna has built-in features (wishlist, recently viewed) reducing need for third-party modules

pain_points.description: High cost of essential modules - prices range from $27 to over $3000, quickly driving up total costs
pain_points.opportunity: All Moderna features included free - wishlist, AJAX cart, multi-address checkout

strengths: Large marketplace with many theme options
competitors.market_position: Leading open-source e-commerce platform in Europe, especially France. Strong among SMBs wanting full e-commerce control.

competitors.name: WooCommerce Themes
competitors.description: WordPress e-commerce plugin with ecosystem of themes and extensions, most popular e-commerce solution globally

pain_points.description: Heavy, bloated themes causing severe performance issues - some stores take 20+ seconds to load
pain_points.source: WooCommerce documentation, XTemos Forums, WisdmLabs blog
pain_points.frequency: Very frequent - multiple dedicated troubleshooting guides exist
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna uses lightweight Alpine.js and Tailwind CSS, designed for <90% PageSpeed scores

pain_points.description: Multipurpose themes with tons of unnecessary features - load dozens of CSS/JS files even where not needed
pain_points.source: WP Rocket speed optimization guide, DebugBear analysis
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna is purpose-built for e-commerce only, no bloat from unrelated features

pain_points.description: Page builders (Elementor, Divi, WPBakery) add significant overhead and complexity
pain_points.source: WP Engine speed guide, Pressable optimization article
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna uses native Twig templates - no heavy page builder overhead

pain_points.description: Plugin conflicts cause instability - poorly optimized plugins drag down site performance
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna integrates features natively, fewer external dependencies

competitors.market_position: Dominant market share globally, especially for WordPress users. Best for content-heavy stores wanting blog integration.

competitors.name: Shopify Themes
competitors.description: SaaS e-commerce platform with curated theme marketplace and proprietary Liquid templating

pain_points.description: Theme updates overwrite all custom code - custom modifications lost unless they don't conflict with update
pain_points.source: Veronica Jeans Shopify blog, Shopify Community Forums
pain_points.frequency: Major frustration for developers doing customizations
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna is self-hosted, full control over updates and customizations

pain_points.description: Support staff not technical - brush off problems by suggesting apps, can't help with Liquid code or performance issues
pain_points.opportunity: Open-source allows community-driven support and code transparency

pain_points.description: SEO limitations - rigid URL structure (/collections/, /products/ paths cannot be changed), basic blog format
pain_points.source: Ecorn agency '8 Common Issues with Shopify' article
pain_points.opportunity: Thelia/Symfony allows full URL control and SEO optimization

pain_points.description: ThemeForest themes are unsupported, outdated, incompatible with apps - look nice but cause problems
pain_points.source: Reddit discussions via AVADA blog summary
pain_points.frequency: Strong Reddit consensus against third-party themes
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna actively maintained with modern stack, not marketplace abandonware

pain_points.description: Variant limits - 100 variants per product, restricting complex product configurations
pain_points.source: Shopify Community Forums, Ablestar limitations article
pain_points.frequency: Frustration for stores with complex products
pain_points.opportunity: Thelia has no arbitrary variant limits

competitors.market_position: Market leader in SaaS e-commerce. Best for non-technical merchants wanting hands-off solution. Premium pricing.

competitors.name: Flexy (Thelia Default Template)
competitors.description: Default template included with Thelia installations, uses older technology stack

pain_points.description: Outdated design and UX patterns - default template lacks modern e-commerce features
pain_points.source: Project roadmap_discovery.json - pain point from target audience
pain_points.frequency: Primary reason users seek alternative templates
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna provides modern, conversion-optimized design with Alpine.js interactivity

pain_points.description: No built-in wishlist or customer engagement features
pain_points.frequency: Key missing feature for customer retention
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna includes persistent wishlist with localStorage + server sync

pain_points.description: Page reloads for cart operations - no AJAX interactions
pain_points.source: Project roadmap_discovery.json - target audience pain points
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna has AJAX cart drawer, no page reloads needed

pain_points.description: Older tech stack - uses legacy templating and styling approaches
pain_points.frequency: Barrier for developers wanting modern DX
pain_points.opportunity: Moderna uses Twig, Tailwind CSS, Alpine.js, Stimulus - modern stack

competitors.market_position: Default option for Thelia users. Functional but basic. Starting point for custom development.

market_gaps.description: Performance-optimized open-source e-commerce templates are rare - most themes are bloated with unnecessary features
market_gaps.suggested_feature: Continue focus on PageSpeed 90%+ scores, minimal JS/CSS footprint, server-side rendering where possible

market_gaps.description: Built-in customer engagement features (wishlist, recently viewed) usually require paid add-ons
market_gaps.suggested_feature: Expand wishlist functionality with sharing, price alerts, and back-in-stock notifications

market_gaps.description: Checkout UX is poor across 64% of e-commerce sites - 70%+ cart abandonment rate industry-wide
market_gaps.suggested_feature: Implement checkout optimization: guest checkout, minimal form fields, progress indicators, one-page option

market_gaps.description: Mobile e-commerce experience often neglected - 63% of users abandon due to preventable mobile UX issues
market_gaps.suggested_feature: Mobile-first checkout flow, touch-optimized interactions, faster mobile load times

market_gaps.description: Modern JavaScript frameworks (Alpine.js) rarely used in e-commerce templates - most use jQuery or heavy frameworks
market_gaps.suggested_feature: Showcase Alpine.js best practices, provide developer documentation for extending interactivity

market_gaps.description: Lack of well-maintained open-source Thelia 3 templates with Twig support
market_gaps.suggested_feature: Position as the premier Thelia 3 template, comprehensive documentation, active community engagement

top_pain_points: Performance and bloat - themes are too heavy, causing slow load times (20+ seconds in worst cases)
High costs - essential features require expensive paid add-ons ($27-$3000+ per module)
Quality decline - marketplace themes degrading in quality while prices increase
Developer dependency - themes become unusable when original developers stop supporting them
Checkout friction - 70% cart abandonment driven by poor UX (too many form fields, forced account creation)
Mobile experience - 63% of users abandon due to preventable mobile UX issues
Customization limitations - SaaS platforms overwrite custom code on updates
differentiator_opportunities: Modern tech stack (Alpine.js + Tailwind CSS) provides lightweight, performant alternative to bloated themes
Built-in wishlist and recently viewed products eliminate need for paid plugins
Open-source community model avoids single-developer dependency risk
Purpose-built for e-commerce - no bloat from multipurpose theme features
Native Twig templating - no heavy page builder overhead
Full customization control - self-hosted without SaaS platform restrictions
Free alternative to expensive PrestaShop/WooCommerce premium themes
market_trends: Performance is paramount - PageSpeed and Core Web Vitals increasingly important for SEO and conversions
Mobile commerce accounts for 70%+ of transactions - mobile-first design essential
Checkout optimization can increase conversions by 35%+ - major focus area
Users prefer lightweight, fast-loading sites over feature-heavy slow ones
Open-source e-commerce growing as alternative to SaaS platform fees
Alpine.js and Tailwind CSS gaining adoption for lightweight interactivity
